text: Eugene Paul "E. P." Wigner (November 17, 1902 â€“ January 1, 1995) was a Hungarian-American theoretical physicist who also contributed to mathematical physics. He obtained American citizenship in 1937, and received the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1963 "for his contributions to the theory of the atomic nucleus and the elementary particles, particularly through the discovery and application of fundamental symmetry principles". ==References== Category:1902 births Category:1995 deaths Category:Nobel Prize in Physics winners
title: Eugene Wigner
